result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. Micke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any period of supervision currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig S. Micke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 3:31 p.m. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater enhancer dismissed. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 30 mos probation concurrent to any term of period of supervision currently being served - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Craig S. Micke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states medication issue needs to be addressed. Requests additional date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Craig S. Micke
Current: 142 N Oak St, Hancock, WI 54943 United States  (Effective: 07-30-2015)
Prior: 130 Northwest St, Neshkoro, WI 54960
NOH Ret'd - Remailed to 142 N Oak St, Hancock 54943

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Requests add'l STC - offer extended that is being negotiated.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:05 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:48 AM: Defendant Craig S. Micke in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:50 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi has no position regarding bond. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 11:45 am.
